question: When there's drama in your friend group, you typically:

answers.text: Stay out of it completely
Quietly help smooth things over behind the scenes
Address it directly and try to fix it
Honestly? Sometimes I stir the pot a little

question: At a party with people you don't know well, you're most likely to:

answers.text: End up being the life of the party
Float around and chat with lots of different people
Find one or two people I click with and stick with them
Hang back and observe before jumping in

question: When playing sports or games, what matters most?

answers.text: Winning — I'm naturally competitive
Doing my best, but it's not that serious
Having fun with friends is the real goal
I'd rather watch than compete

question: Your approach to backup plans and safety nets:

answers.text: Always have multiple contingencies ready
I like having a Plan B, just in case
I prefer to trust my abilities over backups
I go with the flow — things usually work out

question: Which work environment brings out your best?

answers.text: Corporate or professional settings with clear structure
Hands-on work where I can build or fix things
Creative or unconventional environments
I adapt well to any environment

question: In group projects, people usually see you as:

answers.text: The leader who drives the vision
Influential, but not in an obvious way
A reliable contributor who doesn't need the spotlight
The one people underestimate until crunch time

question: How much do you care what others think of you?

answers.text: A lot — I want to be respected and well-liked
I care, but I'll do what's right even if unpopular
Results matter more than popularity
Honestly, not much — I do my own thing

question: When making decisions in a group, you usually:

answers.text: Know exactly what's happening and vote with confidence
Have good instincts about which way things are going
Sometimes get caught off guard by the outcome
Often find myself on the losing side

question: If you could do something challenging again, would you?

answers.text: Absolutely — I'd keep coming back for more
Yes, especially if I could apply what I learned
Maybe, if the circumstances were right
Once was enough — I'd move on to new things

question: What kind of environment do you thrive in?

answers.text: Simple and straightforward — no gimmicks needed
A bit more complex with room to strategize
High-stakes with lots of twists and surprises
Fast-paced and chaotic — I adapt quickly
